required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of YAG Iridotomy in Preventing Peripheral Anterior Synechia After CLASS in Primary Open Angle Glaucoma
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of YAG Laser Iridotomy in Preventing Peripheral Anterior Synechia After CO2 Laser-Assisted Sclerectomy Surgery in Primary Open Angle Glaucoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effectiveness of YAG laser iridotomy in preventing peripheral anterior synechia after CO2 Laser-Assisted Sclerectomy Surgery and the long-term effect of reducing intraocular pressure

detailed_description.textblock: Group A: YAG laser iridotomy was performed one week before operation, followed by CO2 Laser-Assisted Sclerectomy Surgery; Group B: only CO2 Laser-Assisted Sclerectomy Surgery; The patients were followed up for 1 year to observe and compare the difference of the incidence of peripheral anterior synechia and the effect of long-term intraocular pressure control between the two groups.

arm_group.description: YAG iridotomy was performed one week before operation, and then CO2 Laser-Assisted Sclerectomy Surgery was performed

intervention.description: YAG iridotomy was performed one week before operation, and then CO2 Laser-Assisted Sclerectomy Surgery was performed

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China

facility.name: Eye center, 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
